page.title: 08General Area Review
page.content: This area is typical Hants/Wilts downland, farmed extensively with large fields, but containing good hedges and windbreaks.There are two wooded areas, one a woodland of ancient origin lying in the Porton Down restricted area and the other of recent time, the Caravan Club Site at Lopscombe Corner.Hedges are mainly on the roadside, the others having been grubbed up to cope with the large combines, balers and multi_furrowed ploughs.All farming is mechanised,no fields left fallow.Ground is ploughed planted, seed drilled tractor driven with corn,oil seed rape or root crops. Corn is sometimes undersown with grass seed for hay or sileage the following year. Some fields are permanent pasture. Lay_byes and verges are left to encourage the flora and fauna.
